page.title: List of tools to create Live USB systems

rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1:
The following is a list of tools designed to create [[Live USB]] systems:
The following is a list of tools designed to create [[Live USB]] systems:
â
*[[UNetbootin]] installs [[Ubuntu]], [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], and many other [[Linux distribution|distributions]], runs on Windows and Linux.
+
*[[UNetbootin]] installs [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], and many other [[Linux distribution|distributions]], runs on Windows and Linux.
*[[Fedora Live USB creator]] installs [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], runs on Windows and Linux.
*[[Fedora Live USB creator]] installs [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], runs on Windows and Linux.
*[[Ubuntu Live USB creator]], the tool included in Ubuntu 8.10, installs [[Ubuntu]], runs only on Linux.
*[[Ubuntu Live USB creator]], the tool included in Ubuntu 8.10, installs [[Ubuntu]], runs only on Linux.
â
*[[cd2usb]], windows tool to create Live USBs of [[Ubuntu]] and [[Super OS]] (already included in [[Super OS]])
+
*[[cd2usb]], windows tool to create Live USBs of [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] and [[Super OS]] (already included in [[Super OS]])
*[http://aligunduz.org/FUSBi/ FUSBi], based on [[UNetbootin]], downloads distributions endorsed as 'free' by the [[Free Software Foundation|FSF]].
*[http://aligunduz.org/FUSBi/ FUSBi], based on [[UNetbootin]], downloads distributions endorsed as 'free' by the [[Free Software Foundation|FSF]].
